CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 12, 1964, pg. 9 reads: "Viewing Hill Art Show - John Lytel (far left, with glasses in hand), leader of the Lytel Trio, currently playing the Crawford Grill, contemplates the purchase of some of the art offerings being displayed at the Hill District Art and Music Society's new Art Show gallery, at 2015 Centre Ave., while Mrs. Beatrice Smith and her daughter, Rosalind, nicknamed "Rusty," shown in center of photo, watch as Cy Morocco (second from left), who had abstracts in the show; Anthony Upshur, and Edward Ellis, who offers portraits and impressions, express comment about the various are offerings. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group, from left: John Lytel, Cy Morocco, Beatrice Smith, Rosalind Smith, Anthony Upshur, and Edward Ellis, gathered in front of painting at Hill District Art and Music Society's  Art Show Gallery
